   <link>http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/Rpgcast/~3/FfPyuB3YEB0/rpgcast314.mp3</link>
   <description>Natural doctrines come along so infrequently that you'd think we'd notice when one was cresting over the horizon. The record keepers come, gathering magic in 2015 like an unexpected inquisition in the age of ten quests for dragons. Nevertheless, the Inazuma Eleven will go forth and seed unrest among the various personas.    <title>RPGCast - Episode 3: "No Mobile Gaming"</title>
   <link>http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/Rpgcast/~3/VsQzcW16KvY/rpgcast003.mp3</link>
   <description>RPGamer's got the Halo 3 coverage you so desperately need...no of course we don't. Escape the Halo overload with our coverage of <a href="http://www.rpgamer.com/event/tgs2007/index.html">TGS</a>. We go through all the interesting RPGs that were on the show floor with Paul Koehler, who was there on the scene to cover it all for us. Paul will discuss his thoughts of <a href="http://www.rpgamer.com/games/other/ps3/whiteknight/whiteknight.html">White Knight Story</a> <a href="http://www.rpgamer.com/games/ff/ff4ds/ff4ds.html">Final Fantasy IV DS</a>, <a href="http://www.rpgamer.com/games/tales/toi/toi.html">Tales of Innocence</a>, and much more with Anna-Marie Neufeld, Mikel Tidwell, Bryan Boulette, and Chris Privitere. Oh and don't worry, we still get in our weekly love fest for <a href="http://www.rpgamer.com/games/persona/persona3/persona3.html">Persona 3</a>.<img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/Rpgcast/~4/VsQzcW16KvY" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>

   <title>RPGCast - Episode 2: "Now with Gong"</title>
   <link>http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/Rpgcast/~3/tmuK594w_Qc/rpgcast002.mp3</link>
   <description>This week we have Anna Marie Neufeld (Paws), Mikel Tidwell (Firemyst), Adriaan den Ouden (Omegabyte), and Chris Privitere (sabin1001).  We take a look at some of the games that came out of Microsoft's TGS pre-event, the new Pokémon GTS site and the demo of Folklore on PS3.  We also gush over <a href="http://www.rpgamer.com/games/persona/persona3/persona3.html">Persona 3</a> and <a href="http://www.rpgamer.com/games/ff/fftpsp/fftpspprev.html">Final Fantasy Tactics: The Lion War</a> some more and have Adriaan discuss his recent <a href="http://www.rpgamer.com/games/hack/hackgu3/reviews/hackgu3strev1.html">.hack//G.U. review</a>.<img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/Rpgcast/~4/tmuK594w_Qc" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>

   <description>RPGamer's podcast debuts with a chat about the week's news, a look at <a href="http://www.rpgamer.com/games/wa/wa5/wa5.html">Wild ARMs 5</a>, and a discussion of recent releases <a href="http://www.rpgamer.com/games/other/xbox2/bluedragon/bluedragon.html">Blue Dragon</a> and <a href="http://www.rpgamer.com/games/sd/hom/hom.html">Heroes of Mana</a>.  This is our first podcast folks, so be gentle, and thanks for supporting us as we get things going.
